Award.AwardTitle: SaTC: Student Travel Support for IEEE CNS 2018

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
This proposal supports student travel to attend the 2018 IEEE Communications and Network Security Symposium to be held in Beijing, China in May 2018. CNS is a primer venue for communications and networking researchers to present new research results, focusing on communications and network security. This travel grant will enable career development and learning opportunities for US-based and/or US citizen graduate students. Attending conferences is an important component of graduate school education for our society's future computer security researchers. Students have the opportunity to discuss leading edge research with world-class computer security researchers, and establish networks, connections, and mentoring relationships that will serve them well during their research careers.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
IEEE Conference on Communications and Network Security (IEEE CNS) is a spin-oﬀof the top-ranked networking conference, IEEE INFOCOM, and has been positioned as a prime venue for communications and networking researchers to present new research results. IEEE CNS is currently the only IEEE ComSoc conference focusing on communications and network security, and all of its previous editions were highly successful by gathering hundreds of attendees representing various areas within the communication and network security community. IEEE CNS provides a unique platform for world-leading researchers and practitioners to present their latest research results. Therefore, attending such a high-impact venue is of critical importance for the success of graduate students. The attending students will have the opportunity to showcase their work, receive invaluable feedback, attend workshops, and interact with several top-notch experts conducting research in the ﬁeld of communications and network security.

This award supported 14 graduate students in the United States to attend the IEEE CNS conference held at Beijing, China from May 30 to June 1, 2018.  The travel grants targeted graduate students who can substantially benefit from attending this conference but have limited travel funds. Priority was given to first-time attendees, and students from under-represented groups (female, minorities, and students with disabilities).

 


Last Modified: 03/08/2019
Modified by: Attila A Yavuz
